violations.issue: The interface provides no information or feedback to the user, as no components are detected. The user is left in the dark regarding what the application is doing or what state it is in.
violations.improvement_suggestion: Ensure that the UI displays content, loading indicators, or empty state messaging to inform the user of the current status.

violations.issue: There are no visible elements, icons, or labels for the user to interact with, meaning there is nothing to recognize. This forces the user to rely entirely on memory or guesswork to proceed.
violations.improvement_suggestion: Implement standard UI components (buttons, navigation bars, text fields) with clear labels and icons to minimize cognitive load.

violations.issue: In the absence of any UI elements or onboarding flow, there is no guidance for the user on how to use the application or what its purpose is.
violations.improvement_suggestion: Provide contextual help or an initial onboarding experience to guide the user through the app's features.

mobile_specific_issues.issue: No navigation hierarchy or interactive elements (like a Bottom Navigation Bar or Tab Bar) were detected.
mobile_specific_issues.recommendation: Establish a clear navigation structure using platform-standard components (iOS Tab Bar or Android Bottom Navigation) to allow users to move through the app.

mobile_specific_issues.issue: No interactive touch targets detected, making the interface completely non-functional for mobile use.
mobile_specific_issues.recommendation: Add interactive elements with a minimum size of 44x44pt (iOS) or 48x48dp (Android) to ensure they are accessible for touch input.
